VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility’s
budget and the agency’s financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The facility was highlighted to have a low amount of staff turnover,
especially within their treatment program. Staff reported feeling supported by their
direct supervisor and feel the directors of the program are always offering support.
Staff highlighted that they complete over the required amount of training hours and
that has been beneficial to be able to work together as a team and help support the
youth coming into the programing.
Two youth within the detention programing and two youth within the residential
program were interviewed. All youth reported feeling safe at the facility and having
a positive relationship with staff. Youth reported the only time they have seen a
restraint occur is when a youth is being unsafe to themselves or others. Youth
noted they had no concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on September 27,
2023.There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
